channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IL

item.title: Report X-2024010656
item.description:
Report X-2024010656

item.title: Report E-2024010483
item.description:
Report E-2024010483

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-01T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-23
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 23, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3475 was punctured during loading and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews observed the released material evaporated prior to their arrival. HCE personnel placed the damaged 55-gallon drum of product into one (1) 95-gallon drum.

item.title: Report X-2024010830
item.description:
Report X-2024010830

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-01T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-05
  • City: MARION
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was loaded on its side allowing it to leak out onto other packages. Upon discovery package was bagged and put in a haz tote, the area affected was cleaned, and the other packages were gathered up to assess damage. DescribePack: Package was loaded on its side. Lid worked loose enough to leak liquid out of outer box and onto other packages. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was quickly bagged and put in a haz tote.

item.title: Report E-2024010476
item.description:
Report E-2024010476

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-30T15:10:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-17
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a 1-gallon release of Base White (UN1866) from one 55-gallon metal drum. The drum was punctured by XLA staff during loading, spilling to the dock floor. The SDS for the material was reviewed with the terminal and it was determined that the terminal staff would safely clean the spill, containing the drum, and clean up debris to a 95gal metal overpack drum. The waste was left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024010519
item.description:
Report X-2024010519

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-29T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-17
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AN AIR PACKAGE WITH VISIBLE FROST FORMING ON THE OUTSIDE BROKE OPEN REQUIRING A REWRAP. UPON INSPECTION WE FOUND APPROXIMATELY 22 POUNDS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING MEAT. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED IN THE AIR NETWORK. THERE WAS AN ADDITIONAL DISCREPANCY WITH THE THERMAL LABEL STATING THE PACKAGE WEIGHED 12 POUNDS, BUT THE ACTUAL PACKAGE WEIGHT IS 39 POUNDS.

item.title: Report X-2024010678
item.description:
Report X-2024010678

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-29T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-15
  • City: CHAMPAIGN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE FOUND AS JUST TORN ENVELOPE WITH LITHIUM IRON PHOSPHATE RECHARGEABLE BATTERIES INSIDE. NO BATTERY MAKINGS WERE ON THE PACKAGE. UPON INSPECTION, THREE BATTERIES HAD BUSTED, AND TWO MAY BE MISSING (FOUR BATTERIES PRESENT). UNKNOWN CAUSE OF RUPTURE, BUT HEAT IS LIKELY. IT IS POSSIBLE THE BATTERIES WERE SHIPPED THIS WAS, AS THE PACKAGE IS A RETURN. DescribePack: THREE BATTERIES BURST. TWO BATTERIES MAY BE MISSING. ENVELOPE WAS TORN. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE CONTAINED.

item.title: Report X-2024010596
item.description:
Report X-2024010596

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-26T15:11:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-20
  • City: NORTHBROOK
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS INFORMED OF A LEAKING HAZMAT IN BAY 17 UNLOAD. AFTER DONING PPE AND PROCURRING A SPILL CART RESPONDER PROCEEDED TO SAID BAY. THERE WAS A HAZMAT IMMEDIATLY VISIBLE ALONG WITH A PUDDLE ON THE FLOOR AND SEVERAL PACKAGES AROUND IT THAT WERE WET FROM THE BOTTOM. UTILIZING THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED INTO A LINED SPILL TUB AND TRANSPORTED TO THE PSC AREA ALONG WITH THE SET PACKAGES FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. ONE OF THE BOTTLES HAD A CRACKED CAP.

item.title: Report X-2024010650
item.description:
Report X-2024010650

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-01T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-31
  • City: CAROL STREAM
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Discovery of package was around 7AM, while unloading from trailer# 829871 in the bottom of the belly near the front area. Package outer top area was wet with inner leakage. It was quickly taken out and verified no other package was damaged or soiled by spilled contents. DescribePack: Bottles had loose caps on and with the slightest touch opened easily. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Moved and placed in a hazmat spill bag.
